dt: {bc}a country or region brought under the control of the ancient Roman government
{bc}an administrative district or division of a country
{bc}all of a country except the metropolises
{bc}a division of a country forming the jurisdiction of an archbishop or metropolitan
{bc}a territorial unit of a religious order
{bc}a biogeographic division of less rank than a region
{bc}an area that exhibits essential continuity of geologic history
{bc}one characterized by particular structural or petrological features

pt: {sc}function{/sc} {sc}office{/sc} {sc}duty{/sc} {sc}province{/sc} mean the acts or operations expected of a person or thing. {sc}function{/sc} implies a definite end or purpose or a particular kind of work.

pt.t: the {it}function{/it} of language is two-fold: to communicate emotion and to give information

pt: {sc}office{/sc} is typically applied to the function or service associated with a trade or profession or a special relationship to others.

pt.t: they exercise the {it}offices{/it} of the judge, the priest, the counsellor

pt: {sc}duty{/sc} applies to a task or responsibility imposed by one's occupation, rank, status, or calling.

pt.t: it is the judicial {it}duty{/it} of the court, to examine the whole case

pt: {sc}province{/sc} applies to a function, office, or duty that naturally or logically falls to one.

pt.t: I felt it was not my {it}province{/it} to inquire

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French, from Latin {it}provincia{/it}
shortdef: a country or region brought under the control of the ancient Roman government
an administrative district or division of a country
all of a country except the metropolises

dt: province of Pakistan and formerly of British India on the border with Afghanistan; capital Peshawar {it}population{/it} 11,658,000

shortdef: province of Pakistan and formerly of British India on the border with Afghanistan; capital Peshawar population 11,658,000

dt: former province of Prussia, Germany, bordering on Belgium; capital Koblenz

shortdef: former province of Prussia, Germany, bordering on Belgium; capital Koblenz

dt: former province of the southern part of the Republic of South Africa; capital Cape Town {it}area{/it} 278,465 square miles (724,009 square kilometers)
